snippet: Antonin Scalia’s death will complicate the work of the remaining justices, as some cases could result in 4-to-4 deadlocks, and strengthen the Supreme Court’s liberal wing.
abstract: Death of Justice Antonin Scalia will complicate work of Supreme Court's eight remaining justices until end of court's term, and is likely to change outcomes of several major cases and boost power of its liberal bloc; six current or upcoming cases involving abortion, contraception, unions, voting rights, affirmative action and immigration will be affected, with liberal wing likely to command a majority or at very least lead to 4-to-4 deadlock.
lead_paragraph: Antonin Scalia’s death will complicate the work of the remaining justices, as some cases could result in 4-to-4 deadlocks, and strengthen the Supreme Court’s liberal wing.

headline.main: Scalia’s Absence Is Likely to Alter Court’s Major Decisions This Term
headline.print_headline: Missing Voice Is Likely to Alter Major Decisions of This Term
